keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations

byline.original: By MICHAEL R. GORDON and ERIC SCHMITT

lead_paragraph: Maintaining the unity of the coalition against the Islamic State may require the United States to agree to a broadening of the campaign to include terrorist groups that have declared themselves to be “provinces” of the Islamic State.
snippet: Maintaining the unity of the coalition against the Islamic State may require the United States to agree to a broadening of the campaign to include terrorist groups that have declared themselves to be “provinces” of the Islamic State.
abstract: Islamic State's efforts to expand its influence beyond Iraq and Syria have led to debate over whether 60-nation coalition appointed by United States should broaden its effort to fight insurgent group; Islamic State has begun effort to organize militants in Libya.
